I said to him, "Hey Travolta, who the heck is your agent and why do you keep taking these cripey roles?" I give him credit though, he looked back at me very cooly and said, "I fly airplanes and I'm married to Kelly Preston, you're wearing an enormous sombrero and spandex bike shorts -- who are you to judge me?"Touche, Senor Travolta. amazon_clothes__A3U7SC5HOS58OA__13636512.text: I had this horse head in my shopping cart for weeks, just waiting to pull the trigger. I finally did and couldn't wait to put it on and instantly be awesome. The box it arrived it was extremely small and when I opened it up, the mask was wadded up. When I took the mask out, the hair for the mane fell off in clumps and also this horrible toxic odor came pouring out with it. It smelled like spray paint, mixed with latex, mixed with big foot's dick. I figured if I aired it out overnight it would be fine, I was way off. I febrezed the hell out of it, and it stilled smelled like death. You couldn't put it on without gagging. I went online to read other reviews and I definitely received a fake. The description on Amazon states it is bagged with illustrated tag. Mine wasn't bagged and didn't have a tag. The mask was sold to me by Hot As Seen On TV Products so buyer beware if that's who you are purchasing this from. I'm jealous of everyone else who was lucky enough to get a real one, and my search continues.

amazon_video_games__ADPEAVHFCNLLC__13229.text: Arkham City is a bigger, badder, and better version of Arkham Asylum.  It's a perfect interactive blend of the Chris Nolan movies and Batman the Animated Series (2004-2008).Concept:  10/10!!!Hugo Strange has taken over an isolated part of Gotham City and turned it into a giant free range prison.  Unfortunately, Bruce Wayne is trapped inside with the world's most notorious villains.  But once he gets to his gear, he's BATMAN!  And that's a good thing because it means YOU'RE BATMAN!  In Arkham City, you can go anywhere, fight thugs, perform side quests, search for Riddler Clues, or continue with the main story at your own pace.  It's a Strong Candidate for Game of the Year.Story:  10/10In Arkham City, the Joker injects Batman with his own blood.  Aside from being really disturbing, Joker's blood contains a deadly virus.  Batman must infiltrate the territories of Two Face, the Penguin, the Joker, and many others to find a cure.  I don't want to spoil anything here, but this game is loaded with many of the Best Batman Characters of all time.Gameplay:  8/10There are five basic types of gameplay:  Combat, Stealth, Riddler Clues, Boss Battles, and Detective WorkThe Combat functions as it did before, but now there are more gadgets to unlock and more enemy types to battle.  There's a counter attack button, an attack button, an evade button, and a stun button.  Typically, you point in the direction of the enemy and press the attack button and Batman will perform the best fighting animation based on angle and distance.  The same is true with counter attacks.  Attacking enemies will have an icon above their heads when you can counter them.  If you press the button at the right time, Batman negates their attack and attacks them.  In a typical encounter, Batman fights about 4-20 enemies and if you're good, you can stand right in the middle of them and take them out with ease, because that's what Batman would do.Advanced Combat deals with gadgets.  During combat you can activate Batarangs, a Grappling Hook, Ice Bombs, Detonation Mines, or an Electrical Charge.  If you start to lose the fight, you can usually grapple hook out of there and escape.  Basically, as you are fighting, you want to dish out as much damage to enemies as possible, while countering their attacks.  After a while, you'll get really good at this and you'll have some great looking fights while feeling like Batman.The only downside to combat is that there are special enemies who you have to attack by pressing Evade, Evade, Attack, or Stun, Evade, Evade...  And it gets hard to remember what you have to do.  The game would have been much better if the function of the buttons never changed and some enemies were resistant to one attack or significantly more dangerous than the others.  If a special enemy hits you a few times, text appears telling you how to hit him.  At this point, you feel less like Batman.The Stealth Gameplay is very user friendly and much less punishing than other games.  Remember Metal Gear and Splinter Cell?  If a guy saw you, you had to play the last 15 minutes over?  Not here.  When Batman encounters enemies with guns, stealth helps out quite a bit, but it is not necessary.  There are gadgets to distract enemies (Sonic batarang), gadgets to incapacitate enemies (explosive gel), gadgets to render their guns useless (disruptor), environmental props that help you and hurt them (breakable walls, floors, ceilings, generators, floor grates...) And even if they see you, you can still fight your way out of it with a smoke bomb or special attack moves (disarm).  Batman can also see enemies through walls and plan a strategy to take them out.  You are not punished for not using stealth, it just helps.  If you play the game right and use your environment, the guards don't stand a chance... because you're Batman!There are 440 Riddler Clues and Challenges in the game that unlock arena battles, arena stealth games, concept art, trophies, Riddler Side Quests, etc...  They are scattered throughout the city.  Some you just need to find, while others require a puzzle.  To be perfectly honest... there are WAAAY TOO MANY!  I've gotten about 120 of these so far, and I am starting to hate video games.  To get some Achievements, you have to:  Find the clues on the map, solve the puzzle to get the clue, unlock a mini-game, play the mini-game in ranked mode and do awesome on it...  It's too much.  Proportionally, 33% of the game is the main quest.  67% of the game are these damn clues.  The good news is that they are optional.  Because you want to be Batman, not the Riddler's B****.The Boss Battles are fun and require you to use combat skills, stealth, or both.  They're very cinematic and satisfying!  And they showcase the awesomeness of Batman!Because Batman is also a detective, there are parts of the game where you use your CSI skills to track down an enemy.  These are pretty simple, yet rewarding and lead you to other quests.  This is what Batman does.Navigation:  10/10Batman can use his grappling hook to quickly pull himself through Arkham City, or use his cape to quickly glide through areas.  It's really easy and fun to get from one end of the city to another.Graphics:  9/10Arkham City, the characters, the visual effects, all look great.  The game is also playable in 3D mode so you can feel even more like Batman!!!  The areas of Arkham City are very stylized and look like they came right out of a Chris Nolan movie.  The characters are a blend of psychotic and creepy, and Batman looks great.Sound:  9/10The music is suspenseful, epic, and exciting.  The voice acting well cast and well acted!  The dialogue is funny / creepy.  The FX punctuate the action!Maturity:  TIt's a violent graphic novel come to life... or an interactive Batman Movie.  There's violence, blood, and insane villains.  Mild Language because this is a city full of criminals, but it's not like a Quentin Tarantino film.Replay Value:  6/10After you finish the game, there are the Riddler Challenge Arenas, a Hard Mode, Downloadable Content, and a Super Hard Mode where the combat is tougher and there are no visual indicators over the bad guys' heads.  The only problem with the replay is that the combat lacks depth and starts to feel repetitive if you do all of the extras.  The main campaign is about 10 hours long, 14 with the side quests.  If you do the Riddler Challenges, that could be another 12 hours.  That's another 12 hours of fighting, without any new story elements, gear, enemies...  The gameplay starts to feel like a grind at that point.Overall:  9.5/10This is a GREAT Action Game!!!  The graphics, story, and sound create the perfect atmosphere for a Batman Game.  The gameplay is easy to learn, forgiving, and fun.  It does get a bit stale if you play all of the extras though.Buy it if you want to be Batman!Buy it if you love Batman!Buy it if you loved Arkham Asylum and wanted a bigger, better version of it!Buy it if you love sandbox games.Rent it if you have about 12-14 hours to blow through the campaign and side quests.Avoid it if you really need deep combo juggle combat like Ninja Gaiden or Bayonetta.Avoid it if you don't like dark stories.

Other times the using the L3 button to hold breath it wont let me use L3 at all, or it does some different random function. It does this at random intervals during the game. amazon_movies_tv__A1DJQEQ1MOL4Q__9587808.text: "Scream 2" was not as good as the first one, but it's not far away. You'll have to see the first to totally get this, (I will not tell you why, because then I would reveal the whole plot.) but what horror-fan  hasn't. The actors are the same, except for the ones who got killed in the  previous movie. As all the "Scream" movies, it's not related to  something supernatural, but maybe just that makes these movies a litlle  more interesting. (But thank God for not every movie is as "real"  as this one. Just imagine what the world would be without "Friday  13th" and "Nightmare on elm street") The reason why this  wasn't so good, was simply beacause I didn't get scared as much, but I have  heard people who liked this one best, so I guess you'll just have to see it  yourself, but I promise you...you won't be dissapointed.

amazon_cd_and_vinyl__A1LKBVKBHII5T5__997.text: So you want to know just how and why Stevie Ray Vaughan became a star in the first place? It begins here. There was always a sensitive intensity to his playing which turned up missing somehow on his otherwise worthy studio recordings (even on the shattering "Texas Flood" or the resurrective "In Step"), and which got either mixed deep in the big muddy ("Live Alive") or overcome by its own history (the otherwise shimmering, posthumous Carnegie Hall CD) on his live albums. Not this one. The kid knew what he was doing from square one and, even though he couldn't (and never really did) get the Hendrix aspirations out of his system, you'll forgive him because he's playing here as though there really is a hellhound on his trail. And it yanks his rhythm section along for a ride comparable to a starving dog attacking a lamb roast. By the time Stevie Ray and the boys get finished, there's not a strand of meat left over.He can't resist letting flash override substance here and there (I mean, let's quit kidding ourselves: he wasn't exactly allergic to letting the show take over for awhile, his most wounding flaw), but there is no question but that this kid meant it from end to end. Stevie Ray Vaughan may not have started the great late 1970s-early 1980s blues revival, but without question he made the most of it. Don't let the absence of his soon-to-be-familiar crowdpleasers throw you, either. In fact, if you'd been in the crowd for this particular show, your only question would have been what was taking the record companies so long to catch his fire. As it turned out, he didn't have that much longer to wait...

reuters__training/81.text:
N.Y. BANK DISCOUNT BORROWINGS 64 MLN DLRS
  The eight major New York City banks had
  64 mln dlrs in average borrowings from the Federal Reserve in
  the week to Wednesday February 25, a Fed spokesman said.
      The week marked the second half of the two-week bank
  statement period that ended on Wednesday. The banks had no
  borrowings in the prior week.
      Commenting on the latest week, a Fed spokesman said that
  all of the borrowing occurred yesterday and was done by fewer
  than half of the banks.
      National data on discount window borrowings are due to be
  released at 1630 EST (2130 GMT).

youtube__67915.text: If you have a male kitty over 5 years of age, most fish is very unsafe for him to eat & will cause him to develop urinary stones.  Fish as a treat, once in a "blue moon" is OK, but not too often.  Stones hurt a kitty as badly as it does a human & can also cause infection, which can kill him unless treated quickly.  Try poultry or red meats instead of fish as a treat if he is over 5.  Most cats LOVE chicken & turkey.

amazon_video_games__A3V6Z4RCDGRC44__1040.text: This computer game is based on the popular TV series. The gameplay does a good job of having you feel like you're in an exciting episode of the show.The characters and voices are right from the TV show, so you really feel like you're part of the action. You head out to the crime scene - a woman was killed while jogging in Central Park. You search the scene for evidence, and then start talking to various suspects.You can choose your strengths, so you can know which questions not to ask, or you can get help finding evidence by having them highlighted. You have your crime lab and research lab examine evidence, and your surveillance team watches the people. As you find more clues, you track down more people to talk to. Get enough evidence, and you can request a search warrant, and eventually accuse someone of the crime.That's when things get turned over to the lawyers. Now you try to prosecute this criminal, calling witnesses, discussing evidence, objecting to bad questioning. If you do a good enough job, you can nail the perpetrator!The game definitely draws you along, You eagerly await the results of the tests you request, and wonder what the people you are talking to are hiding. You have an inkling of what you are looking for, and dig around until you track it down.On the downside, the game is extremely single-threaded. The only way you can talk to person X is to investigate item Y - but you have no idea that it's item Y you need to submit out of the 50+ items you find at the scene. You can't carry them all, and you get scolded for picking up each item or submitting too many to evaluate. Where in a normal crime scene you'd figure the crew would gather up all evidence and sift it for you, here you get deducted moments for each "thing" on the ground (you don't know what it is until you pick it up) you even look at! So it almost forces you to play each half of the game many times - a few times to figure out what all the items *are* and which are important, and then a last time to actually just touch the items you now know "by osmosis" are important to your case.The same is true during questioning of various people - questions that seem to be quite related end up causing the person not to answer questions that you actually need. They randomly decide at a point not to talk to you further - even if you have more questions for them. For example, a cleaner has his cart parked on a key point of evidence. But ask him the wrong questions and you cannot ask him to move his cart, even though he's still standing right there!Finally, even though I use my system for many, many games of all types, this one crashed on me very frequently. It just meant even more frequent saves and restores, beyond what the gameplay already forced on you through its single-mindedness.Recommended to a fan of the show, and a great concept. Hopefully future releases will address some of these issues and give the game more open gameplay, as in real world detecting.

amazon_video_games__AG35H9HPV2R99__13740.text: Ehhhhhhhh... This was my first DC game. I was happy at first, but... Ehhhhhhhhhh...It has good games and stuff, but the Genesis ports sound like something that would be on the Master System. When a 16 bit game sounds like an 8 bit game, you know you have a problem. It seems like all the work went into the only two games that weren't Genesis games. Virtua Cop 2 was perfectly ported from the Sega Saturn, and Sega Swirl is primarily a Dreamcast game.Another major flaw is that if you want to change the game, you have to reboot the Dreamcast. It gets annoying.It says that each Genesis game was test played, but if it was, IT WOULDN'T SOUND LIKE NES, and the switching games thing is a problem that Sega had since the first compilation on the Genesis, the Sonic compilation.It's a good compilation, but I don't reccomend it.

amazon_video_games__A1X8QMXISE6QE4__1050.text: This is an excellent game. It is loads of fun and fairly lengthy. It will satisfy any fan of Wolverine and is definitely worth playing or owning. The camera can be a little loose, but you get by. Also, some of the pacing is bad in that some levels can get very long and hard, and if you die you have to start at the beginning. It can get bothersome, but it only happens on the stealth levels: once or twice. The implementation of Wolverine's senses has been captured perfectly. When you go into sense mode, everything becomes orange, allowing Wolverine to see the green scent trails of enemies in rooms, hidden threats (landmines, laser beams), footsteps of soldiers, and points where you can pull off stealth moves on an enemy. While on the topic of stealth attacks, you can sneak up on soldiers in sense-mode, push X, and pull off a cool stealth move in order to grab the enemy's dog tags. The battle system is a bit bland, but since the controls are fairly smooth, it's still fun. Also, you can pull off melee strike attacks, with which you can down multiple enemies at once. There are several boss battles- all very fun- and a plausible story written by Marvel/Wolverine scribe Larry Hama. Several costumes are also hidden in the game, so you can play as any generation's Wolverine. The costumes include New X-Men, classic Yellow and Blue, classic Brown and Yellow, Patch, and X2 Movie. There's plenty of variety in this game, including some first person shooter elements, and plenty of cameos by other characters. I definitely reccomend it.

amazon_video_games__A2W5K1J5D3AP__126308.text: Microsoft makes me feel like I'm living in the movie "Ground Hog Day" with how many times I've had to re-purchase their faulty console. I'm a serious gamer and have never took sides in these so called console wars. I clean, maintain and take excellent care of all my consoles. My original Playstation is close to 14 years old, My PS2 is 9 years old, My Dreamcast is 10 years old, My Gamecube is close to 8 years old and they all still play games and operate perfectly.Now saying that, I glare at what should be called the LEMON of all created consoles the dreaded Xbox 360...Since 2005 I've had to replace 4 of these pathetic beasts. Drive failures, Disc read errors, Death from unknown causes after updates and the list goes on.Sure they have excellent games like for example Crackdown, Halo and Fable 2 and thats why I'm purchasing another but Microsoft should build a better and longer lasting console. I can't help but wonder if they do it purposely to pad their sales figures.I took away 2 stars because of my experiences with their faulty consoles and the money I've had to spend replacing them.

amazon_movies_tv__AE8S5IRQWDHS__10713600.text: Why oh why are people saying this film is "fantastic".... why are you saying this movie is "disturbing".  Oh poor mislead people....Only one word can sum up this nasty little piece of work, and that word is "CRAP".  My video player is still vomiting reels of brown turd colored tape, theres no way I'll subject my DVD player to anything as bad as this.  And not bad in a thrilling "Im so scared" way, but bad in an "Oh my god, I cant believe this was ever recognised as a structured film" kind of way.  I simply dont understand how anybody involved in even the most amatuer of film making could have edited this and said "oh yes, this is the final cut we will use".  I have seen better films from year 9 High School media projects.  You can watch this for a laugh at how bad it is, but, please people, I know everyones views are different, and everyone has their own opinion on what is "artistically" appealing to each and every person, but, this is not a horror movie, this is not art, this is just a bunch of unskilled idiots both behind and in front of the camera running around in someones over grown back yard making fools of themselves.  Forget it and I want a refund.... complete trash, utter rubbish.... a pile of steaming flie blown offal....as another reviewer stated previously.... I wish I could have the 82 minutes back that I wasted watching this poo !!

entities.name: EC WHEAT RELEASE UNLIKELY TO SATISFY U.K

reuters__training/12971.text:
EC WHEAT RELEASE UNLIKELY TO SATISFY U.K. DEMAND
  The European Commission's decision to
  release an additional 300,000 tonnes of British intervention
  feed wheat for the home market will provide only moderate
  relief in an increasingly tight market, traders said.
      Some operators had been anticipating a larger tonnage,
  pointing out that at this week's U.K. Intervention tender the
  market sought to buy 340,000 tonnes but only 126,000 tonnes
  were granted.
      The new tranche of intervention grain is unlikely to
  satisfy demand, they said, and keen buying competition for
  supplies in stores is expected to keep prices firm.
      The release of the feed wheat followed recent strong
  representations by the U.K. Grain trade to the Commission.
  There has been growing concern that rising internal prices,
  triggered by heavy exports, were creating areas of shortage in
  interior markets.
      The latest EC authorisation will add 70,000 tonnes at the
  April 14 tender and a further 30,000 tonnes later in the month.
  The remaining 200,000 tonnes will be made available in May and
  June.
      News of the release produced an early downward reaction in
  local physical markets, but by midday some sections had halved
  early two stg losses while others were unchanged.
      Ministry of Agriculture figures for March indicate 1.85 mln
  tonnes of wheat and 1.74 mln tonnes of barley remain in the
  free market. However, some traders believe these figures are
  overstated and, while some may still be held on the farm, the
  bulk of wheat is already sold. Some of the grain is also off
  the market in futures stores.
      A total of 2.10 mln tonnes of intervention wheat has been
  sold for export or to the home market since the season started
  July 1, leaving an unsold balance in intervention of about 1.59
  mln tonnes.
      Intervention barley sales have reached just over 1.0 mln
  tonnes, leaving about 753,000 tonnes, traders said.
      This season's U.K. Export performance has surpassed all
  early expectations and has created the present nervous
  situation in domestic markets where the fear now is free market
  supplies may not last out until new crop becomes available in
  August.
      The market is sticking to its recent prediction of total
  barley and wheat exports of around 10.5 mln tonnes, a new
  record and nearly double the previous record of 5.9 mln tonnes
  achieved in the 1984/85 season.
      Traders expect U.K. Wheat exports to reach 6.0 mln and
  barley around 4.50 mln tonnes.
      The Soviet Union has booked a record total of 2.5 mln
  tonnes of British wheat and barley this season, but only 1.28
  mln had surfaced in Customs export figures by March 25, traders
  said.
      Other EC countries have bought large amounts of British
  grain and for the July 1/March 25 period had taken 2.59 mln
  tonnes of wheat and 2.06 mln tonnes of barley. This compares
  with 1.28 mln and 868,700 tonnes last season.
      The market is expecting prices, particularly wheat, to stay
  buoyant for the remaining few months of the season. If supplies
  become more difficult and prices strengthen further, feed
  compounders may increase cereal substitute usage, traders said.

entities.name: EC WHEAT RELEASE UNLIKELY TO SATISFY U.K

amazon_android_app__APRVP6TWRKFB__133513.text: It's certainly not the go equivalent of Chessmaster.  It's clearly not a comprehensive go teaching software package.  That's ok though because I never expected it to be that and the developer didn't try to sell it as that.  It's just an android app.  It might eventually become the kernal around which a full-blown go software gaming package could develop someday.  I think it's a terrific little app & I'm quite satisfied with it's performance.

amazon_android_app__A2I6K79UB1DPOG__1353.text: In this Halloween app you must collect the correct number of ingredients for the witch's brew.  To move the witch you tilt the kindle which doesn't allow for very easy control.  Items bounced off the witch even when you moved out of the way.  I wasn't a fan of this and my 4 and 6 year old got tired of it real quick. Even though it's only 99 cents I'd save my money.
